summary:
I am an all round technical and commercial professional with a solid background in Oil and Gas Drilling and Production. I am currently employed in  a business with close ties to this Industry. My strengths are my technical and communication skills in multiple languages such as Dutch, English and German. 
In my current job I provide pipeline pigging products such as Pig Launchers and Receivers, Pig Handling Systems, Pig Signalers and Pipeline Pigs. My expertise also extends beyond this to ancillary products such as Valves, Locking Systems and Automated Systems.
Specialties: Acquisition, Technical Evaluation, Commercial Evaluation, Sales, Marketing, Preparation of Technical Documentation, Project Management, Project Control, Communication, Languages,  Pigging Products, Valves, Pressure Vessels.

projects.description: Supply of multiple Launcher / Receiver packages through both Foster Wheeler Energy Services who handle the Jetty side of the project and Daewoo Engineers & Constructors who handle the Tank Farm side of the project. Pipeline pigs (scrapers) were also supplied. Sadara is a joint venture between Dow Chemical and Aramco.

profile_positions.description: As ‘Department Manager’ my resposibilities were extended to include acquisition, reporting to the Managing Director, budget control, marketing and after sales. My current activities involve sales and marketing of Pipeline Pigging products and Valves, providing the right products from a comprehensive range manufactured and supplied by PEB. These include valves, automated valves, including sub-sea systems, pigtraps, pig handling systems , Pipeline pigs, pigging products, pig signallers.
profile_positions.title: Manager Piping Products

profile_positions.description: I started working in the Piping Products Department as an ‘Internal sales en product specialist’. At the time PEB was the agent for TK Valve ball valves that were mainly manufactured in Dunfermline, Scotland. PEB utilizes a system of ‘single point contacts’ which means the product specialist is responsible for all aspects of an order. This ranges from technical and commercial interpretation of enquiry packages to sales, procurement and subcontracting, inspection and certification, delivery, order logistics and all financial aspects.
profile_positions.title: Product Engineer

profile_positions.description: After completing my education, I started my professional career working with Eastman Christensen as an MWD/Survey Application Engineer. My responsibilities consisted mainly of supporting our field engineers. I also gained experience in ‘Old-School’ survey techniques with magnetic and gyroscopic survey tools in Oman. In addition to these tasks, I became heavily involved in the development and introduction of the latest MWD technology. In collaboration with the technical staff we were responsible for taking the latest MWD system from the drawing board to the commercial stage. In this period I was sent to Houston to monitor pressure and flow loop testing and the general development of the tool.  During the advanced development phase I became liaison between our the R&D departments in Celle, Germany and Houston, Texas.
profile_positions.title: MWD/Survey Application Engineer

profile_positions.description: My third apprenticeship was with an offshore drilling company. Here I worked as a roughneck on both the Penrod 67 and the Penrod 64 rigs. In that capacity I worked full shifts as part of the drilling crew, gaining operational experience with the entire drilling process. I further participated as part of the skeleton crew during the rig move of the Penrod 64.
profile_positions.title: Roughneck

profile_positions.description: My second apprenticeship was with Bluewater, an operator of Single Buoy Mooring Systems and FPSO’s. During this period I worked for in Southern China. The work was conducted on a production tanker (FPSO) LAN SHUI which was moored to a buoy in the South China Seas. The remainder of the work took place on the shore base and offices in Shekou (Southern China). On board of the FPSO my duties were to act  as back to back for the production supervisor. On- shore I assisted the base manager and represented him in his absence. This meant gaining experience in both the operational as the administrative aspects of an internationally operating company. In China this also meant maintaining relations with official (Government) representatives as well as with suppliers.  On board I learned about operating the production installation on the FPSO and in addition the maritime aspects of running such an installation on a ship during all sorts of adverse conditions. This also involved working as part of a small team and managing an international crew.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Production Superintendent

profile_positions.description: In my first apprenticeship from the ‘Hogeschool Voor Petroleum en Gastechnologie’ I worked for a wireline service company. I worked with them from September to November 1988. During this time I was allocated a large variety of responsibilities. It was during this period that McCullough was taken over by 'Western Atlas Wireline Services' in Den Helder. While McCullough was mainly involved in ‘cased hole logging and pipe recovery’, Atlas had more experience in ‘open hole logging’. For myself this meant that I had the good fortune of exposure to both disciplines. The experience was gained both at the shore base and on several offshore locations in the North Sea.
